intro: Hieracium neoplatyphyllum subsp. izzense, commonly known as the Izzé's hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has dark green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
